# Description

Protect and safeguard genetic diversity (within and between species populations) of wild, managed, and cultivated species for human well-being and ecosystem resilience.

# Proposed EBVs

[Hoban et al (2022](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/brv.12852)) have proposed the following Genetic Composition Essential Biodiversity Variables:

-   Genetic diversity: Richness and evenness

-   Genetic differentiation: number of genetic units and differentiation between units

-   Inbreeding

-   Effective population size (Ne)

# EBVs characteristics

[Hoban et al (2022](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/brv.12852)) summarized the four Genetic Composition Essential Biodiversity Variables (ranking from low (+) to high (+++)).

| **Genetic EBV**                                                                                                          | **Genetic Diversity**                          | **Genetic Differentiation**                                                   | **Inbreeding**                                                                                                 | **Effective Population Size (*N*~e~)**                                                                                                       |
|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Number of genetic units**                                                                                              | **Differentiation between units**              |                                                                               |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                              |
| **Richness**                                                                                                             | **Evenness**                                   |                                                                               |                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                              |
| Definition                                                                                                               | Count of the number of alleles in a population | Expected proportion of heterozygotes in a population at equilibrium           | Number of genetic lineages/units within a species                                                              | Degree of genetic differentiation among populations or units                                                                                 |
| Examples                                                                                                                 | Allelic richness, nucleotide diversity (π)     | *H*~e~, *H~O~*                                                                | Number of distinct evolutionarily significant units or management units                                        | *F*~ST~, *G*~ST~, *D*~est~                                                                                                                   |
| Range of values                                                                                                          | 0 to 1                                         | 0 to 1                                                                        | ≥1                                                                                                             | 0 to 1                                                                                                                                       |
| Level of organization                                                                                                    | Population                                     | Individual/population                                                         | Across species range or specific region                                                                        | Across species range or specific region                                                                                                      |
| Interpretation of a change identified across loci                                                                        | Decline indicates loss of adaptive capacity    | Decline indicates loss of adaptive capacity or increased levels of inbreeding | Loss of independent evolutionary or demographic units (probable loss of adaptations and long-term persistence) | Increased differentiation indicates more fragmentation (reduced gene flow) between units; decreased differentiation indicates homogenization |
